AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: All JFFT systems are located in controlled access areas. Reference the JFFT Physical and Environmental (PE) security artifact. Copy is provided on eMASS and the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: All users and their privileges are listed on the JFFT Authorized Accounts Register (AAReg). AAReg is approved by the JFFT ISSM. Copy is provided on eMASS and the JFFT NIPR sharepoint portal.

AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: Reference JFFT STIG Policy and Documentation Guidance artifact. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: Reference JFFT STIG Policy and Documentation Guidance artifact. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT prohibits and trains privileged users to not use privileged accounts to access the Internet. Reference JFFT Access Control (AC) security controls artifact, security control AC-6(2) for the policy. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT requires application passwords be at least 15 characters. in length. Reference JFFT Access Control (AC) security control artifact (AC-2) and the JFFT Account Management SOP for the policy. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT requires application passwords be changed annually. Reference JFFT Access Control (AC) security control artifact (AC-2) and the JFFT Account Management SOP for the policy. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: Reference JFFT STIG Policy and Documentation Guidance artifact. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: Recovery time and objectives are documented in the JFFT Continuity Planning (CP) security control artifact (CP-2) and the JFFT Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP). Full disk backup of each server is done using VMWare or AWS (depending on hosting environment) snapshot features. Snapshots enable full recovery of system level information.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: Recovery time and objectives are documented in the JFFT Continuity Planning (CP) security control artifact (CP-2) and the JFFT Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP). Full disk backup of each server is done using VMWare or AWS (depending on hosting environment) snapshot features. Snapshots enable full recovery of user-level informtion.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT backups are protected using same Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availbility (CIA) requirements as the rest of the enclaves' technical architecture. CIA categorization is approved by the AO and the entire JFFT cybersecurity program is built to meet those requirements.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: Recovery time and objectives are documented in the JFFT Continuity Planning (CP) security control artifact (CP-2) and the JFFT Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP). System-related documentation is specifically addressed in the DRP.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT does not have a strict requirement for protecting data transfers. However, JFFT does implement encryption (i.e. TLS, VPNs, IPSEC) for to the maximum extent possible to accomodeate DOD and Army protection requiremements and PPSM compliance.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT systems do not require additional encryption protection due to inadequate physical protection. All JFFT systems and information is stored in DoD or AWS facilities that comply with DoD and Army physical protection requirements. Reference JFFT Physical and Envrionmental (PE) security controls artifact for details. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT requires audit data be retained for one year. Reference JFFT Auditing (AU) security control artifact (AU-11) for details. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT requires audit data be backed up to Splunk or AWS cloudwatch Logs. Reference JFFT Auditing (AU) security control artifact (AU-4(1)) for details. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT requires audit data be backed up in real-time to Splunk or AWS cloudwatch Logs. Reference JFFT Auditing (AU) security control artifact (AU-4(1)) for details. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT only authorized administrators access to member servers if they are certified and appointed as required by DODM 8570. Reference the JFFT Authorized Accounts Register (AAReg) for list individuals with administrative privileges.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: JFFT systems monitor for unauthorized changes to executable files. AESS Policy Auditor and File Integrity Monitor (FIM) are deployed to servers on all JFFT domains.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: All necessary services for each JFFT server are documented in its corresponding configuration baseline. The JFFT Configuration Manager maintains the baselines and can provide copy upon request. Contact Kevin Deardorff.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: All JFFT systems support automated patch management. JFFT uses MS SCCM and WSUS to automate patching. Reference JFFT System Integrity (SI) security control artifact (SI-2) for JFFT policy on flaw remediation and the JFFT Patch Management SOP. Copy is provided in eMASS and on the JFFT NIPR and SIPR sharepoint portals.

AnswerKey.Name: DEFAULT
AnswerKey.ValidTrueComment: All JFFT systems are configured with Axway Desktop Validator software.
